授業目的: ＜Lecture＞ This is a supported lecture course so students will listen to a lecture in English that is supported by vocabulary and skills development. The lectures are based on the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and will also provide the topics for the reading and discussion and writing courses described below. ＜Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion＞ The purpose of this course is to help students develop their academic discussion and research skills. Students will use input from the lecture, readings and their own research to discuss SDG-related topics. ＜Lecture Bridge Reading and Writing＞In this course, students will improve on the writing and research skills. We will especially focus on reading source material, summarizing/quoting, and critically evaluating materials from the three Lecture Bridge courses. ＜Special Topics> Special Topics courses are a chance for students to choose and study a topic through English. Each EC5 Special Topics course is different. The topics are determined by the teacher. Please check "学部/研究科からのお知らせ (Notice from undergraduate/graduate schools)" for more information about each course.
到達目標: <Lecture> Students will improve: English lecture listening skills, reading and research skills, note-taking and vocabulary knowledge. <Discussion> Students will be able to discuss and present about SDG-related topics from a problem-solution perspective, hold extended discussions on a topic, and use discussion strategies. <Writing> Students will be able to summarize SDG related articles, conduct independent research and incorporate that into a framework of knowledge on a topic, critically evaluate input, improve on the essay writing skills and language developed at the EC3 and 4 level. <Special Topics> Students will be able to review and practice EC skills while developing topic-specific knowledge and vocabulary.
特記事項: 【合併】English Communication V　Ａ（総合政策学部）/英語コミュニケーションV　Ａ（総合政策学部）
授業方法: Materials, instruction, and all class communication are in English. Course materials will be available to students through LUNA.

トピック.授業計画1:
*All 14 classes will be conducted face-to-face.
Each topic will be introduced on a three-week cycle following a problem - solution genre. The first week, will introduce an SDG, providing background information and important definitions. The second week will address the causes of the problem and the interrelatedness of the topic with other SDGs. The third week will introduce a solution to the problem and discuss its successes and limitations. Materials and topics will follow the lecture course while also introducing discussion skills and improving vocabulary knowledge. The majority of the course will be spent researching, summarizing and writing academic essays. The schedule for each Special Topics course will depend on the teacher and will be announced to students at the beginning of the class.
トピック.授業外学習2: <lecture> Students will read and complete preparation worksheets for each lecture. Students will need to review materials for a midterm and final exam. ＜Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion＞ To prepare for the discussions, students will read articles, attend the lectures, and research the topic on the Internet. In the discussions, they present, discuss, and explore the topics based on the lecture, reading, and research. <writing> Students write academic essays as well as read articles and prepare for in-class quizzes. <special topics="topics"> Each Special Topics course will have different homework associated with the topic.</special></writing></lecture>
